subCards.title: Do high levels of ‘good’ cholesterol mean lower risk of heart disease? How HDL-C is actually linked to cardiovascular health
subCards.abstract: When looking at diagnostic test results, it is important to understand the difference between correlation and causation, to decide on the appropriate intervention. Here, we explain the link between HDL-Cholesterol and heart health.

images.title: Do high levels of ‘good’ cholesterol mean lower risk of heart disease? How HDL-C is actually linked to cardiovascular health

highlights.text:
**Correlation vs causation:** Correlation means two variables are related, but not necessarily cause and effect. Causation means one variable directly affects another. Interventions are only logical when causation is established.

**HDL-C and CV disease:** HDL-C is the "good" cholesterol that is correlated with low CV disease risk. However, it is not a causative factor and increasing HDL-C does not reduce CV disease risk. HDL-C is an indicator of overall good health and cholesterol efflux rate.

**Coffee and other correlations:** Many headlines claim that certain foods or drinks are linked or associated with reduced disease risk. These are correlations, not causations, and should not be taken as intervention strategies. They may reflect other factors that influence health.

subCards.title: Kawasaki Ninja 500 Bookings Open. Check Out Price Of This Bike That Costs More Than Your Average Car
subCards.abstract: Performance and premium motorcycles have exploded in terms of popularity and that's where manufacturers want to be. Kawasaki recently launched its Ninja 500 for Rs 5.2 lakh, which makes it more expensive than some small cars in India. The Ninja 500 will replace the 400 eventually. It gets the same sharp-cut styling with various slashes to bring an even more aggressive look. It competes with the Aprilia RS457 in India and has a new liquid-cooled,...

images.title: Kawasaki Ninja 500 Bookings Open. Check Out Price Of This Bike That Costs More Than Your Average Car

highlights.text: The article introduces the ***Kawasaki Ninja 500***, a new performance and premium motorcycle that costs **Rs 5.2 lakh** in India. The Ninja 500 has a **451cc, parallel-twin engine** that delivers **45 bhp** and weighs **171 kg**. It has a **785 mm seat height** and a **145 mm ground clearance**. It features an **LED headlight**, an **LCD display with Bluetooth**, an **assist-and-slipper clutch** with a **6-speed gearbox**, and **dual-channel ABS**. It comes in **all-black** colour in India, unlike the global variants. The Ninja 500 is **more expensive** than the **Aprilia RS457** in India, but **slightly cheaper** than the **Eliminator cruiser**. Bookings have started and deliveries are expected to start in **March**.

subCards.title: Nine in TEN US doctors say they're suffering burnout 'on a regular basis' and 60 percent have considered quitting, survey shows
subCards.abstract: Burn out has surged among doctors in recent years, linked to staffing shortages in healthcare. An estimated 250,000 jobs as doctors or nurses are currently unfilled in the US.

images.title: MailOnline logo
images.caption: MailOnline logo

highlights.text:
The article reports on a survey by ***Athenahealth*** that reveals the extent and impact of **burnout** among US doctors. The survey interviewed **1,000 doctors** nationwide and found that:

- **More than 90 percent** of doctors feel burnt out **on a regular basis**.
- **60 percent** have **considered leaving the profession** entirely.
- Doctors need to work **an extra 15 hours per week** on average to keep up with their workload.
- Burnout is linked to **staffing shortages** in healthcare, with an estimated **250,000 jobs** unfilled.
- Doctors feel **overwhelmed** by **patient demands** such as frequent texts, calls, and emails.
- **AI** could help doctors **reduce administrative work** and **increase efficiencies**, allowing them to **refocus on their patients**.

subCards.title: ‘My Record Wasn’t Broken’: Wasim Akram Reacts to Yashasvi Jaiswal’s Double Ton in Rajkot Test vs ENG
subCards.abstract: Young batter Yashasvi Jaiswal is currently all over the news for his batting marvel against England in the ongoing Test series. The 22-year-old has played a crucial role in India’s victorious run in the last two games, scoring back-to-back double-hundreds to England’s ‘Bazball’. More importantly, the youngster has been altering the record books with his ferocious knocks.IPL 2024 Schedule Announcement LIVEDuring the third Test in Rajkot, Jaiswal...

images.title: Wasim Akram reacts to Yashasvi Jaiswal equalling his world record
images.caption: Wasim Akram reacts to Yashasvi Jaiswal equalling his world record

panoCaption.title: Ranchi, India, England in the news

highlights.text: The article reports on ***Yashasvi Jaiswal's*** remarkable batting display in the third Test against England in Rajkot, where he scored a **214-run knock** with *12 sixes*, matching former Pakistan captain ***Wasim Akram's*** world record for the most sixes in an innings. Akram had achieved this feat in 1996 against Zimbabwe, scoring an unbeaten *257 off 363 balls*, helping Pakistan avoid defeat. Jaiswal became the **first Indian batter** to convert his first three Test tons into *150-plus scores*, the **third youngest player** to score *two double tons* in the longest format, and the **highest scorer** of any batter in a Test series with *22 maximums*. India also hit a record **28 sixes** in the match, the most by any team in a Test match.

subCards.title: Salaries In India To Increase 9.5% In 2024: Aon survey
subCards.abstract: Salaries in India are expected to increase by 9.5 per cent in 2024, slightly lower than the actual increase of 9.7 per cent in 2023, largely in response to market dynamics, according to global professional services firm Aon plc. According to the firm's annual salary increase and turnover survey 2023-24 India, which analysed data across 1,414 companies from almost 45 industries, salary increase in India seems to have stabilised at high single...

images.title: Salaries In India To Increase 9.5% In 2024: Aon survey

highlights.text:
Possible response:

**Salary increase trends in India**: Salaries in India are expected to increase by 9.5 per cent in 2024, slightly lower than the actual increase of 9.7 per cent in 2023, according to Aon plc. The increase seems to have stabilised at high single digits after the post-pandemic high increments in 2022.

**Attrition rates and employee engagement**: The overall attrition rates fell from 21.4 per cent in 2022 to 18.7 per cent in 2023, indicating a competitive and dynamic job market. Organisations are likely to focus on building a supportive work environment to foster employee engagement.

**Sector-wise salary variations**: Financial institutions, engineering, automotive, and life sciences are likely to offer the highest salary increases, while retail and technology consulting and services will see the lowest salary hikes.

**Global risks and opportunities**: The global workforce faces short-term risks like economic uncertainty and conflicts, as well as long-term disruption from AI/ML. India has a unique proposition of scale and capability for the globe and may be at the forefront of the next wave of AI/ML-led disruption.

subCards.title: Make sure to add these superfoods to your pet's diet
subCards.abstract: The importance of superfoods for pets lies in their ability to enhance overall health and well-being. Just as these nutrient-dense foods benefit humans, they can have a profound impact on the vitality and longevity of our furry companions. Superfoods for pets are rich in essential vitamins, minerals, antioxidants, and other nutrients that can support their immune system, improve digestion, maintain healthy skin and coat, and potentially reduce...

images.title: Make sure to add these superfoods to your pet's diet

highlights.text:
The article explains the importance and benefits of ***superfoods*** for pets' health and vitality. It covers:

- **Nutrient density**, providing essential vitamins, antioxidants, minerals, and other nutrients for optimal health.
- **Immune system support**, combating free radicals and diseases with antioxidants.
- **Digestive health**, promoting healthy digestion and preventing gastrointestinal issues with fiber-rich options.
- **Joint and bone health**, enhancing joint and bone health with omega-3 fatty acids and minerals.
- **Healthy skin and coat**, improving coat shine and health with omega-3 fatty acids.
- **Weight management**, reducing calories while being rich in nutrients for pets on weight management plans.
- **Energy and vitality**, boosting energy levels and overall vitality with nutrient boost.

It also lists some of the **must-have superfoods** for pets, such as *blueberries*, *pumpkin*, *spinach*, *salmon*, *sweet potatoes*, *coconut oil*, *turmeric*, *chia seeds*, *kale*, *quinoa*, *carrots*, *Greek yogurt*, and *broccoli*, and their respective benefits for each category. It cautions that **seeing a veterinarian** is crucial before introducing superfoods to pets' diet.

subCards.title: Miss World 2024: Manushi Chillar To Reita Faria Powell- Indian Women Who Were Crowned In The Past
subCards.abstract: Miss World Pageant 2024: India is hosting the prestigious Miss World pageant this year after a span of three decades, the last one being in the year 1996. Scheduled to take place from February 18 to March 9, the event has begun to unfold in various venues, including the Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi. Miss World 2024 will see 120 contestants from countries across the globe as they participate in various competitions and charitable initiatives. For...

images.title: Miss World 2024: Manushi Chillar To Reita Faria Powell- Indian Women Who Were Crowned In The Past

highlights.text:
The article explores the history and achievements of ***Indian women who were crowned Miss World***, highlighting the current representative of India, **Sini Shetty**, who will compete in the prestigious **Miss World 2024** pageant in India. It traces the history of the pageant, which India hosted last in 1996, and the dates of the current event, from **February 18 to March 9**. It introduces the previous winners of the pageant, from **1966 to 2017**, and their remarkable qualities and contributions. It mentions:

- **Manushi Chillar**, who won in 2017 and advocated for mothers' profession as the highest paid job.
- **Priyanka Chopra Jonas**, who won in 2000 and became a successful Bollywood and Hollywood star.
- **Yukta Mookhey**, who won in 1999 and promoted AIDS awareness and education as a brand ambassador.
- **Diana Hayden**, who won in 1997 and displayed simplicity and genuine desire to help others.
- **Aishwarya Rai Bachchan**, who won in 1994 and wowed the world with her ethereal beauty and confidence.
- **Reita Faria Powell**, who won in 1966 and made history as the first Asian woman to win the title.

subCards.title: Shark Tank India 3: Anupam Mittal Seemingly Mocks Ashneer Grover, Says 'Jisko Gussa Aata Tha Woh...'
subCards.abstract: In the latest episode of Shark Tank India 3, The Rage Room introduced their anger management solution. The Sharks looked surprised as the pitcher explained the concept. When asked if they also experience such anger, Anupam joked, “Jisko aata tha woh gaya (The short-tempered one has left).” Vineeta Singh and Namita Thapar burst out laughing but Anupam quickly apologised. The pitcher, Pusarla Venkat Suraj from Hyderabad, then went on to request Rs...

images.title: Anupam Mittal and Ashneer Grover featured together in the first season of Shark Tank India.
images.caption: Anupam Mittal and Ashneer Grover featured together in the first season of Shark Tank India.

highlights.text: The document is a news article from ***Shark Tank India 3***, a reality TV show where entrepreneurs pitch their business ideas to investors. In the latest episode, **The Rage Room** introduced its *anger management solution* and asked for **Rs 20 lakh** for a **30% equity stake**. The pitcher, *Pusarla Venkat Suraj* from Hyderabad, admitted to having *anger issues* and sought therapy, even breaking things and using 30 phones. The other sharks, including *Anupam Mittal*, *Vineeta Singh*, and *Namita Thapar*, reacted with surprise, humour, and feedback. Thapar warned against promoting the product as a solution to anger issues and stressed the importance of mental health and counselling. The episode aired on **January 22, 2024** and featured the return of several familiar sharks and the addition of new ones.

subCards.title: 'They couldn't even run 2 kms. When fat levels were checked...': Hafeez fumes at Babar Azam for Pakistan fitness culture
subCards.abstract: Hafeez had earlier taken to social media to say that he would reveal the true reason behind Pakistan's poor run in international cricket.

images.title: Mohammad Hafeez lashed out at former Pakistan captain Babar Azam for poor fitness culture in the team
images.caption: Mohammad Hafeez lashed out at former Pakistan captain Babar Azam for poor fitness culture in the team

highlights.text: ***Mohammad Hafeez***, a former Pakistan all-rounder and team director, **slammed former captain Babar Azam** for the **poor fitness culture** in the Pakistan team. He revealed that he had asked for a fitness report on the players before the Australia tour, but the team management had **ordered him to stop checking the players' fitness parameters** and let them play as they wanted. He said that the players' **fat levels were high** and they **could not complete a 2 KM trial run**, showing that they were **unfit to play at the international level**. He blamed the fitness culture for Pakistan's **recent defeats** in the Test, T20I, and ODI formats.

subCards.title: A trip to South India is incomplete if you haven't visited these 11 offbeat destinations
subCards.abstract: A trip to South India is incomplete if you haven't visited these 11 offbeat destinations

slides.title: South India is a haven for tourists especially in the months of December, January, and February. The weather during these months is mostly pleasant and for tourists, it unveils a diverse landscape unlike any other place in the country. Its rich cultural heritage and vibrant traditions provide a one-of-a-kind experience to travellers, be it domestic or international. While popular tourist destinations like Goa, Kerala, and Tamil Nadu captivate foreign tourists, the true essence of the region lies in exploring its offbeat treasures. (Image: Shutterstock)

image.title: Findings: The EPI 2022 Report observed that most ‘Coastal States’ have performed well, with the states of Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka and Gujarat being the top performers in the Export Preparedness Index across the country, in all categories of states. (Image Shutterstock)
image.caption: Findings: The EPI 2022 Report observed that most ‘Coastal States’ have performed well, with the states of Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Karnataka and Gujarat being the top performers in the Export Preparedness Index across the country, in all categories of states. (Image Shutterstock)

slides.title: Venturing off the beaten path, travellers can discover some of the greatest hidden gems in Kerala, Karnataka, Telangana, and Tamil Nadu that resemble places like the Grand Canyon, the Machu Picchu terraces and Lands end in Cornwall, England. Let's take a look at 11 such destinations that Indian and foreign tourist must visit, when exploring southern India. (Representational image: Reuters)

image.title: Gokarna Beach, Karnataka: Moving along the western coast, we find ourselves at Gokarna Beach in Karnataka. Bioluminescent phytoplankton, known as dinoflagellates, create a stunning natural light show. With each gentle wave, these tiny organisms emit a radiant glow, leaving visitors awe-struck by the celestial beauty that surrounds them. As you stroll along the shoreline, the waves shimmer with a mystical glow, creating an enchanting atmosphere that feels straight out of a fairy tale. It's a sight that will surely leave you spellbound and yearning for more. (Representational image: (Image: Reuters)

slides.title: No 1. Poombarai Terrace Farming in Tamil Nadu | This Machu Picchu-like terrace landscape is nestled amid the picturesque landscapes of the Western Ghats. Poombarai terrace farming offers a breathtaking spectacle of vibrant green terraces sculpted into the hillsides. Visitors can wander through the meticulously manicured steps where local farmers cultivate a variety of crops, providing a serene retreat and a glimpse into the traditional agricultural practices of the region. The panoramic views of the surrounding mountains make it a perfect spot for nature enthusiasts and photographers alike. (Image: Shutterstock)

subCards.title: CBI raids Satya Pal Malik's Delhi house in Kiru hydropower corruption case
subCards.abstract: The CBI carried out a raid at the Delhi residence of former Jammu & Kashmir lieutenant governor Satya Pal Malik. The search was conducted in relation to the corruption case involving the Kiru hydropower project. In the past month, the CBI had also conducted searches in Delhi and Jammu in connection with alleged corruption in the awarding of civil works for the Kiru Hydro Electric Power Project, which amounted to Rs 2,200 crore.

images.title: CBI raids Satya Pal Malik's Delhi house in Kiru hydropower corruption case

highlights.text:
- **CBI raids former J&K LG's house**: The CBI searched the house of Satya Pal Malik, who was the governor of Jammu and Kashmir between 2018 and 2019, in connection with the Kiru hydropower project corruption case.
- **Malik claims he was offered bribe**: Malik had alleged that he was offered Rs 300 crore as bribe for clearing two files, including one related to the project, during his stint as J&K governor.
- **Former officials and private company booked**: The CBI has registered a case against former chairman and other former officials of Chenab Valley Power Projects (P) Ltd, and Patel Engineering Ltd for alleged malpractices in awarding a contract worth Rs 2,200 crore of civil works of the project.

subCards.title: Trouble mounts for Byju’s founder & CEO! ED seeks look out circular against Byju Raveendran, says report
subCards.abstract: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has requested the Bureau of Immigration (BOI) to issue a look out circular (LOC) against Byju Raveendran, the founder and CEO of Byju's. The ED's Kochi office had previously opened an LOC 'on intimation' against Raveendran, but the investigation was later transferred to the Bengaluru office. The Bengaluru office of the ED, which is currently investigating alleged Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA)...

images.title: Trouble mounts for Byju’s founder & CEO! ED seeks look out circular against Byju Raveendran, says report

highlights.text:
**ED seeks LOC against Byju's founder**

- The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has requested the Bureau of Immigration (BOI) to issue a look out circular (LOC) against Byju Raveendran, the founder and CEO of Byju's, an edtech company, for alleged FEMA violations.
- An LOC 'on intimation' was previously issued against Raveendran, but the ED's Bengaluru office has sought a revised LOC to prevent his departure from the country.
- The ED issued show-cause notices to Byju's and Raveendran last November, citing alleged violations totaling Rs 9,362.35 crore under FEMA. The agency also conducted searches at Byju's premises and Raveendran's residence last year.

cards.title: Triumph Tiger 1200 range updated for 2024
cards.abstract: Triumph has given its flagship Tiger 1200 range a small, yet important, update for 2024, with the changes being more evolutionary than revolutionary. Preload Reduction drops seat height by up to 20mm Footpegs of GT models repositioned for more cornering clearance Triumph Tiger 1200 changes for 2024 For 2024, the biggest change to the Tiger 1200 is the new Active Preload Reduction feature, which was revealed back in August last year. This feature...

images.title: Triumph Tiger 1200 price, power, seat height, comfort.
images.caption: Triumph Tiger 1200 price, power, seat height, comfort.

highlights.text:
- **Active Preload Reduction**: The new feature lowers the seat height of the Tiger 1200 by up to 20mm, making it easier to reach the ground at a stop. It can be activated by pressing a button on the handlebar.
- **Improved cornering clearance**: The GT Pro and GT Explorer models have repositioned footpegs that offer more ground clearance when leaning the bike. They also have dampened handlebars and risers for a smoother ride and better mirror visibility.
- **Price and availability**: The updated Tiger 1200 range is expected to cost slightly more than the current models, which are priced between Rs 19.19 lakh – Rs 21.69 lakh in India. The launch date is not yet announced.

cards.title: IND vs ENG, 4th Test: Alastair Cook suggests benching Bairstow in Ranchi, calls for bowling lineup refresh
cards.abstract: Alastair Cook, the former England captain, is advising the team to bench out-of-form wicketkeeper-batter Jonny Bairstow for the Ranchi Test against India, aiming to shield the struggling player. Bairstow, playing as a specialist batter, has had a challenging series, averaging 17.00 with scores of 0, 4, 25, 26, 37, and 10 in six innings. Cook suggests giving Dan Lawrence a chance to step in without the weight of previous performances. However,...

images.title: Former England captain Alastair Cook predicts another victory for England against India in the 3rd Test

highlights.text: The article discusses ***Alastair Cook's*** advice to **bench Jonny Bairstow** for the *Ranchi Test* against India, to protect the struggling wicketkeeper-batter. Cook suggests giving **Dan Lawrence** a chance to bat as a specialist batter, without the pressure of previous performances. Former captain **Michael Atherton** agrees with Cook's suggestion, while England may also consider **resting James Anderson and Mark Wood**, bringing in **Ollie Robinson** and **Gus Atkinson** for the match in *Dharamsala*. England trails the series **1-2**.

cards.title: Sachin Tendulkar smashes unreal cover drive holding bat upside down during 'a match made in heaven'
cards.abstract: Sachin Tendulkar batted briefly against the locals during his visit to Kashmir.

images.title: Sachin Tendulkar doing what he does best.
images.caption: Sachin Tendulkar doing what he does best.

highlights.text:
The article reports on ***Sachin Tendulkar's*** visit to *Kashmir* and his cricket session with the locals. It covers:

- His spontaneous request to join a game of cricket and his impressive cover drive off the last ball.
- His selfie with fans and his caption "Cricket & Kashmir: A MATCH in HEAVEN".
- His tour of a *bat manufacturing unit* and his interest in the Kashmir willow bats and their grains.
- His nostalgic memories of his first cricket bat and his favourite bats with few grains.
- His occasional exhibition games and his recent appearance at a charity match for Australia bushfire victims.

cards.title: WHO: Measles cases rose 79% globally last year
cards.abstract: The World Health Organization (WHO) voiced alarm on Tuesday (Feb 20), about the measles cases that have been rising so quickly. Last year, there were over 306,000 cases worldwide, which is a 79 percent rise from 2022.

cards.title: Ritika Sajdeh's comment adds spice to Rohit Sharma vs Hardik Pandya saga at Mumbai Indians ahead of IPL schedule reveal
cards.abstract: Among the shock revelations leading up to the 2024 IPL was that MI had appointed Hardik Pandya as their captain in place of Rohit Sharma.

images.title: Mumbai Indians replaced Rohit Sharma with Hardik Pandya as captain in December
images.caption: Mumbai Indians replaced Rohit Sharma with Hardik Pandya as captain in December

highlights.text:
The article discusses the ongoing ***Mumbai Indians captaincy saga*** and the contrasting views of **Rohit Sharma** and **Hardik Pandya** on the role and status of the captain. It:

- Highlights Rohit's impressive **captaincy performance** in the ongoing Test series against England, where he scored a century and led India to a record victory margin.
- Recaps the decision to bring back Pandya as a player and captain for the **2024 IPL season**, despite his injury history and inconsistent form.
- Shows Ritika Sajdeh's emotional and sarcastic response to a fan's poem and coach Mark Boucher's explanation, highlighting the personal and cricketing aspects of the saga.
- Provides relevant facts and data from the document to support the main points and details of the saga.

cards.title: Maha Shivaratri 2024: 4 Things You Should Donate To Please Lord Shiva
cards.abstract: Maha Shivaratri is one of the most important festivals in Hinduism. As per beliefs, Lord Shiva got married to Goddess Parvati on this auspicious day. This year, Maha Shivaratri will be celebrated on March 8. It is believed that some food items and other things donated on this day can bring good fortune and luck in your life. A Vastu consultant and astrologer from Bhopal, Pandit Hitendra Kumar Sharma has talked more about it in an interaction...

images.title: A paste made of ghee should be applied to the Shiva Lingam.
images.caption: A paste made of ghee should be applied to the Shiva Lingam.

highlights.text:
The article explains the significance and rituals of ***Maha Shivaratri***, a major Hindu festival that marks the marriage of **Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati**. It suggests four things to donate to please Lord Shiva:

- **Ghee** applied as a paste on the Shiva Lingam stone or donated to the poor and needy to remove negative energies and problems.
- **Milk** poured over the Shiva Lingam to bring happiness, prosperity, and mental peace, and strengthen the weak moon in the birth chart.
- **Black sesame seeds** offered to ancestors to remove their obstacles and complete pending tasks, and increase income.
- **Clothes** donated to a poor person to solve financial problems and get blessings from Lord Shiva.

The article also mentions that Maha Shivaratri commemorates the day when Lord Shiva drank the poison that protected the world from darkness and dismay, and gave his throat a blue color, making him known as **Neelkanth** (blue throat).

cards.title: Iconic Structures Inspired by Others: The World's Most Famous Architectural Copycats
cards.abstract: These surprising iconic buildings are actually copies including The White House, Buckingham Palace, the Empire State Building and Burj Khalifa. Click or scroll through to discover world architecture that nods to other buildings in unexpected places.

slides.title: Iconic buildings based on other structures
slides.body: Architects throughout history have been influenced by earlier works and a surprising number of famous buildings around the world were actually modelled after older gems. From the White House, the Colesseum and Buckingham Palace to the Empire State Building and Burj Khalifa, we've rounded up 20 iconic structures that nod to, draw heavily from or pretty much duplicate other buildings in some unexpected locations. Click or scroll to get started...

image.title: Iconic buildings based on other structures
image.caption: Architects throughout history have been influenced by earlier works and a surprising number of famous buildings around the world were actually modelled after older gems. From the White House, the Colesseum and Buckingham Palace to the Empire State Building and Burj Khalifa, we've rounded up 20 iconic structures that nod to, draw heavily from or pretty much duplicate other buildings in some unexpected locations. Click or scroll to get started...

slides.title: The masterpiece: Notre-Dame de Paris, Paris, France
slides.body: Currently undergoing restoration following the devastating fire of April 2019, the medieval cathedral of Notre-Dame de Paris is among the finest examples of French Gothic architecture and, along with the Eiffel Tower, is one of the French capital's most enduring symbols, as well its most-visited landmark.

image.title: The masterpiece: Notre-Dame de Paris, Paris, France
image.caption: Currently undergoing restoration following the devastating fire of April 2019, the medieval cathedral of Notre-Dame de Paris is among the finest examples of French Gothic architecture and, along with the Eiffel Tower, is one of the French capital's most enduring symbols, as well its most-visited landmark.

slides.title: The inspiration: Qalb Lozeh, Harem, Syria
slides.body: While the cathedral nods to the older Basilica of Saint-Denis just to the north of Paris, its ancestor in terms of design is thought by some scholars to be the unassuming Romanesque church of Qalb Lozeh ('Heart of the Almond') in Syria. Constructed way back in the fifth century AD, the ancient basilica could very well have been the blueprint for Notre-Dame's signature twin-towered facade.

image.title: The inspiration: Qalb Lozeh, Harem, Syria
image.caption: While the cathedral nods to the older Basilica of Saint-Denis just to the north of Paris, its ancestor in terms of design is thought by some scholars to be the unassuming Romanesque church of Qalb Lozeh ('Heart of the Almond') in Syria. cards.title: Coalition of cancer experts pen 'letter to the world' demanding urgent investment amid grim warning that cases will soar by 50% by 2040
cards.abstract: More than 50 charities and experts argued the scientific community now stood at a 'tipping point' requiring a united global response to tackle the disease.

images.title: MailOnline logo
images.caption: MailOnline logo

highlights.text: A coalition of ***more than 50 charities and experts*** issued an **open letter to the world** today, urging donors and philanthropists to **fund vital cancer research**. They argued that the scientific community was at a **'tipping point'** and needed a **united global response** to tackle the disease. They highlighted the **unique opportunity** of the next decade, driven by **AI and technology**, to transform cancer treatment for millions, and the **potential to save and improve countless lives**. They cited examples of **new blood tests, algorithms, and personalised therapies** that could detect cancer earlier and prevent it from developing. They also highlighted the **grim warning** that **global cancer cases are predicted to increase by around 50 per cent by 2040**, and the **domestic challenge** of reducing cancer mortality rates by 15 per cent over the next two decades. They stressed the **need for investment** to bridge the **£1billion shortfall** in research funding, and the **shortfall in UK government funding**, which is only 38 per cent of all publicly funded cancer research. They called for **more philanthropic support** to help bring about a world where **everybody can lead longer, better lives, free from the fear of cancer**.

cards.title: Earth turned into a giant snowball 700 million years ago. Now we know why
cards.abstract: About 700 million years ago, Earth froze, blanketed in ice from the poles to the equator as temperatures plunged.

images.title: Earth turned into a giant snowball 700 million years ago. Now we know why
images.caption: Earth turned into a giant snowball 700 million years ago. Now we know why

highlights.text: The article explains ***how Earth turned into a giant snowball*** 700 million years ago and what caused it. It cites a study published in **Geology** that used **plate tectonic data** and a **computer model** to simulate **CO2 degassing** from **underwater volcanoes** along **mid-ocean ridges**. The study found that a **continental volcanic province in Canada** that started **eroding** and **consuming atmospheric CO2** triggered the **ice age** by lowering the **greenhouse gas concentration** significantly. The ice age lasted for **57 million years**, before **dinosaurs** existed. The article also highlights the **sensitivity of climate** to **carbon concentration** and the possibility of **Earth evolving towards Pangea Ultima**, a supercontinent so hot that **mammals might become extinct**.

slides.title: Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, USA
slides.body: Yellowstone National Park in northwestern Wyoming is famous for its incredible geothermal features including the Grand Prismatic Spring (pictured), Old Faithful Geyser and Mammoth Hot Springs. Colourful because of the heat-loving bacteria, the Grand Prismatic Spring is one of many unique wonders – altogether, there are more than 10,000 geothermal sites in the park.

slides.title: Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, USA
slides.body: Yellowstone was the first national park to be established in the USA (on 1 March 1872) and it takes at least a few days to explore some of its 3,500 square miles (9,065sq km). You'll be sharing the park with bears, wolves, bison and white-tailed deer and the Lamar Valley (accessible from Highway 212) is a great place to spot them.

cards.title: Karma Works Faster For Some People & This Video Of Man Harassing Woman Is Proof
cards.abstract: Sooner or later, everyone has to face the consequences of their actions. A video doing rounds on the internet shows a man trying to misbehave and rob a woman on an isolated street. While similar videos often surface on the net, what caught the user’s attention in this clip was how the man suffered for his action soon. Netizens called it instant karma and were quite impressed with how the situation turned out to help the victim.In the viral clip...

images.title: Tables turned pretty fast on the man. (Photo Credits: X)
images.caption: Tables turned pretty fast on the man. (Photo Credits: X)

highlights.text: The article discusses ***instant karma*** and how it played out in a viral video of a man **harassing and robbing a woman** on an isolated street. A **bus** stopped nearby and several men **attacked the aggressor**, who let the woman escape. Netizens praised the **fast karma** and the **group intervention**, and expressed hope in the world. The article also cites another example of instant karma from the internet, involving a **teenage car wash worker** who **soaked a customer with a hose** after she threw a drink at her.

cards.title: Munawar Faruqui Gets Attacked By Bigg Boss 17 Co-Contestant Anurag Dobhal On Social Media Once Again
cards.abstract: Bigg Boss 17 contestant Anurag Dobhal has slammed Munawar Faruqui once again on social media. He commented on his personal life. Read full story to know more

images.title: munawar faruqui gets attacked by bigg boss 17 co-contestant anurag dobhal on social media once again
images.caption: munawar faruqui gets attacked by bigg boss 17 co-contestant anurag dobhal on social media once again

highlights.text: ***Anurag Dobhal***, a co-contestant of **Bigg Boss 17**, **attacked stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui** on social media again. He posted a derogatory comment on Munawar's personal life and dishonesty in relationships, ahead of his song release, **Halki Halki Si**. The comment went viral and received mixed responses from netizens. Anurag's fans supported him, while Munawar's fans slammed him for his previous actions in the show. The music video with **Hina Khan** is set to release on **February 23, 2024**.

cards.title: Video of iPhone 15 charger burning during use raises safety concerns. Watch
cards.abstract: The post also advises other Apple users to not fall asleep while the iPhone is charging.

images.title: Video of iPhone 15 charger burning during use raises safety concerns. Watch

highlights.text: A video circulating online shows an ***iPhone 15 charger*** **overheating and burning** while the phone was plugged in. The video was posted by *social media user @gracesalons*, who claimed that the charger was an **official Apple product** and was plugged into a **standard wall outlet**. No injuries were reported except a minor burn on the woman's finger. **Apple has not commented** on the incident. The post also advises other Apple users to **not fall asleep** while the iPhone is charging, as it could lead to a **more dangerous scenario**. The video raises questions about the **safety of iPhone chargers** and potential **fire hazards**.

cards.title: 10 Best Aamir Khan movies that showcase his remarkable range as actor
cards.abstract: Renowned for his versatility, Aamir Khan reigns as one of Indian cinema's finest actors, effortlessly mastering roles across genres—be it comedy, romance, or drama. Several of his films have ascended to a cult status, boasting enduring appeal and rewatch value. For avid fans seeking cinematic excellence, we've curated a definitive list of the best ...

images.title: 10 Best Aamir Khan movies that showcase his remarkable range as actor
images.caption: 10 Best Aamir Khan movies that showcase his remarkable range as actor

highlights.text:
The article presents a definitive list of the ***best Aamir Khan movies*** that showcase his remarkable range as an actor. It covers:

- **3 Idiots** (2009), a comedy-drama about friendship and societal expectations, rated 8.4/10.
- **Dil Chahta Hai** (2001), a romantic comedy about three friends navigating life's ups and downs, rated 8.1/10.
- **Andaz Apna Apna** (1994), a comedy about two young men competing for a wealthy woman's affection, rated 8/10.
- **Dangal** (2016), a biographical drama about a father's determination to train his daughters as wrestlers, rated 8.3/10.
- **PK** (2014), a sci-fi comedy about an alien stranded on Earth and a woman in Belgium, rated 8.1/10.
- **Rang De Basanti** (2006), a historical drama about a filmmaker's journey of self-discovery and activism, rated 8.1/10.
- **Lagaan** (2001), a historical drama about a village resisting a British tax regime through a cricket match, rated 8.1/10.
- **Taare Zameen Par** (2007), a drama about a dyslexic boy and his art teacher, rated 8.3/10.
- **Ghajini** (2008), a thriller about a businessman with short-term memory loss seeking revenge, rated 7.3/10.
- **Fanaa** (2006), a romance-suspense film about a visually impaired girl and a charismatic man, rated 7.1/10.

The article provides detailed information about each movie's plot, cast, director, year of release, and where to watch it online. It invites the readers to enjoy the best Aamir Khan movies of all time, whether they choose to watch one or binge them all over the weekend.

cards.title: 'Jadeja clearly the guilty party': AB de Villiers doesn't sugarcoat 'remorseful' run out of Sarfaraz Khan
cards.abstract: AB de Villiers had his say on the unfortunate dismissal of Sarfaraz Khan in the 3rd India vs England Test.

images.title: Sarfaraz Khan walks back after being run out.
images.caption: Sarfaraz Khan walks back after being run out.

highlights.text:
- **Jadeja's run out of Sarfaraz**: AB de Villiers blamed Ravindra Jadeja for the unfortunate run out of Sarfaraz Khan, who was batting well on 62. Jadeja called for a single but backed out, leaving Sarfaraz stranded. Jadeja was visibly upset and apologized on Instagram later.
- **De Villiers' pride for Sarfaraz**: AB de Villiers expressed his pride for Sarfaraz Khan, who made his India debut and scored twin fifties. De Villiers was his teammate at RCB and praised his level-headedness and down-to-earth attitude. He also found the gesture of Sarfaraz and his father blowing kisses to each other very emotional.
